step.title: General Information
step.description: On this screen the general pfSense parameters will be set.

field.name: DNS Resolver Behavior
field.description: The default behavior of the DNS Resolver will ignore manually configured DNS servers for client queries and query root DNS servers directly. To use the manually configured DNS servers below for client queries, visit Services > DNS Resolver and enable DNS Query Forwarding after completing the wizard.

field.name: Primary DNS Server
field.message: Primary DNS Server field is invalid

field.name: Secondary DNS Server
field.message: Secondary DNS Server field is invalid

field.name: Override DNS
field.description: Allow DNS servers to be overridden by DHCP/PPP on WAN

step.title: Time Server Information
step.description: Please enter the time, date and time zone.

field.name: Time server hostname
field.description: Enter the hostname (FQDN) of the time server.

step.title: Configure WAN Interface
step.description: On this screen the Wide Area Network information will be configured.

field.name: MAC Address
field.description: This field can be used to modify ("spoof") the MAC address of the WAN interface (may be required with some cable connections). Enter a MAC address in the following format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx or leave blank.

field.name: MTU
field.description: Set the MTU of the WAN interface. If this field is left blank, an MTU of 1492 bytes for PPPoE and 1500 bytes for all other connection types will be assumed.

field.name: MSS
field.description: If a value is entered in this field, then MSS clamping for TCP connections to the value entered above minus 40 (TCP/IP header size) will be in effect. If this field is left blank, an MSS of 1492 bytes for PPPoE and 1500 bytes for all other connection types will be assumed. This should match the above MTU value in most all cases.

field.name: Upstream Gateway
field.message: Gateway IP Address field is invalid

field.name: DHCP Hostname
field.description: The value in this field is sent as the DHCP client identifier and hostname when requesting a DHCP lease. Some ISPs may require this (for client identification).

field.name: PPPoE Service name
field.description: Hint: this field can usually be left empty

field.name: PPPoE Dial on demand
field.description: This option causes the interface to operate in dial-on-demand mode, allowing a virtual full time connection. The interface is configured, but the actual connection of the link is delayed until qualifying outgoing traffic is detected.

field.name: PPPoE Idle timeout
field.description: If no qualifying outgoing packets are transmitted for the specified number of seconds, the connection is brought down. An idle timeout of zero disables this feature.

field.name: PPTP Local IP Address
field.message: PPTP Local IP Address field is invalid

field.name: PPTP Remote IP Address
field.message: PPTP Remote IP Address field is invalid

field.name: PPTP Dial on demand
field.description: This option causes the interface to operate in dial-on-demand mode, allowing a virtual full time connection. The interface is configured, but the actual connection of the link is delayed until qualifying outgoing traffic is detected.

field.name: PPTP Idle timeout
field.description: If no qualifying outgoing packets are transmitted for the specified number of seconds, the connection is brought down. An idle timeout of zero disables this feature.

field.name: Block RFC1918 Private Networks
field.description: When set, this option blocks traffic from IP addresses that are reserved for private networks as per RFC 1918 (10/8, 172.16/12, 192.168/16) as well as loopback addresses (127/8). This option should generally be left turned on, unless the WAN network lies in such a private address space, too.
field.typehint: Block private networks from entering via WAN

field.name: Block bogon networks
field.description: When set, this option blocks traffic from IP addresses that are reserved (but not RFC 1918) or not yet assigned by IANA. Bogons are prefixes that should never appear in the Internet routing table, and obviously should not appear as the source address in any packets received.
field.typehint: Block non-Internet routed networks from entering via WAN

step.title: Configure LAN Interface
step.description: On this screen the Local Area Network information will be configured.

field.name: LAN IP Address
field.description: Type dhcp if this interface uses DHCP to obtain its IP address.
field.message: LAN IP Address field is invalid

step.title: Set Admin WebGUI Password
step.description: On this screen the admin password will be set, which is used to access the WebGUI and also SSH services if enabled.

step.title: Reload configuration
step.description: Click 'Reload' to reload pfSense with new changes.

step.title: Reload in progress
step.description:
A reload is now in progress. Please wait.

The wizard will redirect to the next step once the reload is completed.

step.title: Wizard completed.
step.description:
Congratulations! pfSense is now configured.

We recommend that you check to see if there are any software updates available. Keeping your software up to date is one of the most important things you can do to maintain the security of your network.
